IMPORTANT NOTICE TO SENIORS CARUTHERSVILLE HIGH SCHOOL RE: MISSOURI A+ PROGRAM
Eligibility for 2020 Seniors ONLY (If you have questions, please contact Mrs. Hutchison bhutchison@cps18.org).
In response to multiple school closures as a result of the COVID-19 virus, the Department of Higher Education and Workforce Development is issuing the following guidance for 2020 high school . . .

div.p:
There is an ongoing investigation to determine more about this outbreak. This is a rapidly evolving situation and information will be updated as it becomes available to the District. Please know we are doing everything we can to keep our students and staff healthy.
Coronavirus Facts from the Missouri Department of Health and Senior Services

a.aria-label: Read more about Coronavirus Information

div.p:
VIRTUAL COURSES
Because virtual instruction can be an effective education option for some students, the district may offer virtual courses to students through district staff or by contracting for those services as part of the district-sponsored curriculum. In addition, eligible students may enroll in virtual courses offered through the Missouri Course Access Program (MOCAP). The district will accept all grades and credits . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Virtual Courses

div.p:
Caruthersville Elementary Preschool & Kindergarten Round-up
For 2020-21 School Year
Caruthersville Elementary will begin preschool and kindergarten enrollment for the 2020-21 school year from Monday, March 2 nd to Friday, March 20 th from 8:30 am to 2:30 pm.
For Preschool enrollment , a child must be 4 years of age by July, 31, 2020. Preschool only has 60 . . .
